Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 4.1 Å (hydrophobic hexagonal pore aperture), 5.1×5.2 Å (hydrophilic triangular pore)
Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Two types of pores: hydrophobic hexagonal and hydrophilic triangular

Other Information.Additional Info: Local optimal operational temperature (LOOT) phenomenon observed at ~30 K for the larger hydrophilic pore; weaker hydrophobic pore contributes only at temperatures below ~30 K.
LOOT phenomenon observed at ~30 K; quantum-induced exclusion dominates at specific temperatures.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale with quantum effects

Experimental Validation.Method: Temperature-programmed desorption (TPD) using advanced cryogenic thermal desorption spectroscopy (ACTDS)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Enrichment factor (EF) varies with pressure and temperature; LOOT identified as ~30 K for larger pore

Other Information.Additional Info: Two sequential desorption peaks observed corresponding to two adsorption sites; weaker hydrophobic pore effective only at low temperatures (<30 K).
LOOT phenomenon observed at ~40 K; quantum-induced exclusion effect reverses dependency on pressure at Texp=30 K.
LOOT phenomenon observed at ~40 K; reverse isotope effect competes with quantum confinement at low temperatures.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale with quantum effects

Experimental Validation.Method: Temperature-programmed desorption (TPD) using advanced cryogenic thermal desorption spectroscopy (ACTDS)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Enrichment factor (EF) decreases sharply at Texp=30 K due to restrained quantum-induced exclusion; LOOT identified as ~40 K.

Other Information.Additional Info: Two adsorption sites observed; secondary site shows weaker interaction potential, contributing to reverse dependency of EF on pressure.
LOOT phenomenon observed at ~50 K; wider cage (~11.6 Å) contributes to cross-linked quantum confinement.
LOOT phenomenon observed at ~50 K; quantum swelling/excluding effect dominates separation performance.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale with quantum effects

Experimental Validation.Method: Temperature-programmed desorption (TPD) using advanced cryogenic thermal desorption spectroscopy (ACTDS)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Enrichment factor (EF) increases monotonically with pressure and reaches a saturated plateau; LOOT identified as ~50 K.

Other Information.Additional Info: Single desorption peak observed except at lowest exposure temperature (Texp=20 K); narrow window and wider cage contribute to quantum confinement.
